newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Petroz eyes Elang field commitment.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Petroz eyes Elang field commitment.

text.p: Oil and gas company Petroz NL said it was reviewing a development proposal for the Elang and Kakatua oil projects in the Timor Sea and was close to a decision to proceed.

"Subject to timely participant and government approvals, we expect project commitment in October, with production scheduled to commence in mid-1998," Petroz said in its chairman's address contained in its 1995/96 annual report.
Petroz has a 14.95 percent interest in the ZOCA 91-12 permit which covers the Elang and Kakatua fields, which is in the Timor Sea Zone of Cooperation between Indonesia and Australia.
ZOCA 91-12 also covers about 50-60 percent of the giant Bayu-Undan gas resource.
The other joint venture partners, are The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd with 42.42 percent, Santos Ltd with 21.43 percent and Indonesia's Inpex Sahul Ltd with 21.21 percent.
